Articles.Content: There are two Program Files KSP works out of, Program Files and Program Files (x86) When I turn my computer on one day it'll be using one of these files, but the next time I use my computer it'll be working out of the other Program Files. I have a few mods but only in one Program Files and can't find out how to get KSP to only work out of one. Can anyone help me please?

It doesn't matter where KSP is installed, you can install it on C:\Potato if you want.

Just click on the KSP.exe in the directory. The one where you have the mods.

How did you get it? Shop or Steam?

Hi Sweeper, if you used the KSP.zip then KSP shouldn't be placed in Program Files as there won't be a Windows registry entry, the zipped KSP should be unzipped to C:\Games or a similar folder you create that is not part of the Windows folder structure.

If you installed via Steam, the Squad installer or GoG, KSP will be in the steamapps folder, C:\Kerbal Space Program or C:\GOG Games\Kerbal Space Program by default respectively.

Also it does matter where KSP is installed because of data execution prevention it's best to just make a C:\Games folder and install KSP there, copy over your preferred KSP install and delete the old ones once you have it all working.
